Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rodicut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far for 4 stars classification; breakfast very poor – and I saw something that socked me: the lady who cleaned the tables, after she collected the dirty plates she found some sweets (croissants and pie) uneaten and she put them back on the buffet table. The coffee is horrible for an Italian hotel. In 6 days, NEVER replaced the shampoos/ shower gel bottles and the sheets were changed only once in 6 nights. Even if WI-FI was free, never worked. Old furniture is not appropriate for a 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten F
Reviews.Content: Nice location for a city trip since close to Metro. Rooms very clean and well kept. We had a nice room on the third floor with a great bathroom. You don't hear any noise from the street, but be prepared to hear your neighbors. But that's really the only negative thing about the hotel. They even arrange transfers to and from the airport which is very convenient. Also they offer a very good breakfast (especially compared to other hotels in Italy).

Reviews.Title: “a little hidden, but good choice”
Reviews.Author: elhseven
Reviews.Content: We arrived April 2nd and stayed until April 6th and overall a good value. The hotel is not close to the most of the tourist attractions so you may want to consider taking the 310 bus or cab to the termini station which is the main transpo hub and also where you would choose from several hop on/hop off tour buses. Upon arriving we actually walked right pass the hotel so make sure you refer to google or yahoo maps. The hotel was clean, linens were changed daily. The breakfast was decent, wifi worked fine and the terrace in the room was nice. The location is near a university & military training facility so the surroundings are fairly safe not to mention there are delicious gelato places everywhere. Just a bit of advice, if you ride the bus system in Rome, buy a ticket. They use an honor system but inspectors ride & check when you least expect to make sure all tickets are valid.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Sima A
Reviews.Content: The location is nice since it's close to the metro station. However, it's not close to any tourist attraction. The room was a bit cold during the night and the air conditioner was not functioning well. The breakfast was of average quality, but the tea and coffee was very cold. Considering the reasonable price, it was ok to stay for 3-4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: sanne2312
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a good location when you are in Rome for a city trip, average 20 minutes traveling (walking and metro) to the historic city centre. Friendly staff, clean room with enough space and average beds. wifi is working free and fine. Breakfast is ok except from the bad coffee. Over all an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chitake m
Reviews.Content: It is the hotel of a quiet place from the Bologna station of Metro for on foot 10 minutes. The room is very clean and there is the dresser with a key equipped with the safety box. Although it was three bedrooms, there is enough space. WiFi could be used also in the room and was very convenient. The front staff can fully communicate in English. Breakfast is a penthouse.The volume of breakfast and a view are satisfying. It is one of a few dissatisfied points that the cafe made by a machine was not tasty. Although it is far from a sightseeing spot, it is the safe place which can feel a local life.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Priya869
Reviews.Content: The location is a little out of the way but easily reachable by Metro (about 8 minute walk from hotel). 2- 3 stops from the railway station. The rooms can be a little noisy but the staff was very helpful and moved us to a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: iljito
Reviews.Content: Plus: Very helpful hotel staff, good location (ca. 5 min to walk to the Bologna Metro Station - Line B), clean room Minus: Breakfast with very limited kind of meals (f.e. only one kind of cheese, no vegetables, no eggs, only 2-3 kind of fresh fruits ...). The walls with other room are very tin - we can hear our neighbours talking, or when they opened the closets etc. The Hotel as self is in good condition, although you can see the age of the building from inside (f.e. the walls in our bathroom). If you get one of rooms in ground level (f.e. Nr. 118), there´s no classical window in your (bed)room, only in bathroom, so it´s a dark room. If you´re the whole day in the city (as we did), it´s not important. Nearby you can find f.e. a Bar Stendal - very nice, also the staff, a bread/cheese/meat shop, a fresh fruit/vegetable shop, drugstore, an Irish pub, one taverna/restaurant and some pizza/kebab bars.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for great value!”
Reviews.Author: sparklingel
Reviews.Content: Great value for your money! It was cozy, comfortable, clean, and an overall great stay. Location is not bad, a few blocks to the metro stop. Decent breakfast, good housekeeping, and I was pleased to even see slippers in my room as well!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good located, with some space for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ityszk
Reviews.Content: Pluses: location, room size, price, breakfast on roof included Minuses: old carpets, broken gym bike in room, too low temperature at breakfast room, same breakfast menu every day, no warm dishes

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: JohannesErlinger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a lively, friendly area with good links to the city (Bologna station an easy 10 minutes walk). The staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to accomodate non-italian speaking guests. Our room was larger than we expected and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was equally generous. Although the fittings and fixtures were not luxurious, they were perfectly adequate, and indeed, for the price, very good. Breakfast was again very generous. There was a great choice of cereal, cold meats, cheese bread, yoghurts, fruit and pastries, and, once again, the staff were unfailingly cheerful and accomodating. Minibar prices were good (2 euros for lager/wine). I recommend this hotel whole-heartedly. PS: On arriving from the station, it is a good idea to take the tube to Bologna as we got rather lost in the warren of streets around Tiburtina Station.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: hesitant_lemming
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by no means a 4 star accommodation, but for the price we paid, we got a good base in Rome. It's a 5 minute walk straight up the road to the metro station in Bologna which is 3 stops (4 or 5 minutes!) from Rome Termini Central Station and only 5 stops from the Colosseum. Breakfast is on the top floor and by European standards was very good. There's hot drinks, fruit juices, plenty of soft croissants and filled pastries fresh from the bakery, fresh bread and rolls, hams, cheese, fruit, yogurts, cereal and muesli, a little toaster etc. All the reception staff were really helpful, polite and friendly. The room itself was quite small, but big enough for 2 people only needing a clean place to sleep at the end of a busy day. The bathroom was big with complimentary bath products but if you're after a bath or shower it's worth noting that if everyone else in the hotel has beat you to it, there'll be no hot water left! The room had a mini bar that is very good value for money once you have experienced the cost of stopping at any of the bars and cafes littering the streets of Rome! We stayed for 3 nights and found ourselves eating at the local Chinese on the nearest roundabout to the hotel. It was the only restaurant we could find where we didn't feel we were being robbed of our Euros! For 2 big 660ml beers, 2 starters, 2 mains and a portion of rice and a portion of noodles we paid 23 euros. Compare that with our first night when we went into a cafe a stones throw away and paid 25 euros for a couple of slices of pizza, 1 potato croquet, a mouthful of peppers, one small beer and one very small fruit juice. No contest! We'd definitely stay here again, it was great value for money in a great place which made it easy to get to everything we wanted to see quickly! Word to the wise though - Rome has no efficient queueing system in place for any of the sites, it's literally a free for all, sometimes involving 100s if not 1000s of people. We first encountered this at the Colosseum and I just couldn't believe what i was seeing. It was simply a case of standing 5 or 6 abreast and shoving your way forward into any available gap and I got fed up of giving evil glances to the people who simply drifted into the side of queues because they didn't want to start at the back. If you intend to visit the Vatican museums DEFINITELY book your tickets online before you go. You don't have to stand in the 2 to 3 hour queue if you do this. You are given a time slot to turn up at and you can smugly walk past all the people to the front of the line which in our case, went around 3 sides of the Vatican! It cost 4 euros per person extra to book online, but it's the best 4 euros I ever spent!!

Reviews.Title: “short trip but excellent”
Reviews.Author: shirin r
Reviews.Content: I and my friend were in this hotel from 5 to 10 february.everything such as location,staff,breakfast,room servise....was very well.I hope visit rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: SaltashOggie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were amongst a party of 14 that stayed in this hotel for a long weekend in mid February. It is situated close to Bologna tube station(5-6 mins) and has a couple of bars and a decent restaurant just across the road. The Hotel itself was very clean, the staff are friendly and the breakfast, although buffet style continental, sufficient for the hungriest traveller. Although the rooms are reasonably modern and well equipped (TV, minibar, hairdryer) they have no hot drink making facilities and the hotel would also benefit from a public bar. From the airport we used the bus service to the central station(Termini) for 15 euro return and then caught a taxi which should cost about 15 euro. To get around Rome use either the bus or tube a ticket costs 1euro for 75 mins but if catching the bus remember to buy your ticket from a bar or tabac prior to getting on the bus as the driver doesn't sell tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: StephanieMaria8888
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel during the snow... So got the train from the airport (leonardos express-1 stop journey to termini) termini is the metro station& central train station. Tip; don't get a taxi to this hotel as it cost us 25euro to get there then learned the day after the metro was only 1 euro per person for 75minutes and it was 3 stops away. You need to go to Bologna metro then walk down the road it's about 10/15 minute walk up the road you pass come to a 2nd round about from the hotel. Try and avoid speaking to people/ obtaining eye contact as they will ask you for money. At one point we had a man follow us. The country it's self is great metro to colleseum is worth it watch the soldiers if they offer to take photos as after then then ask you for 20euros as we learned! But in Rome that's what you need to do ... Learn. Would recommend booking the Roma tour bus we paid £15.00 for both of us for a 2day pass which took us to Vatican city they are lovely. Any way about the hotel... It was lovely the staff are so helpful and try there best to communicate. Hotel room cleaned everyday fresh towels extra pillows in the wardrobe and quilts. Room is nicely presented. With wines water cokes etc nuts,chocolate, crisps there. And a honest price list. We seemed to drink a lot yet our bill was only 9.00 euro during a 3 night stay you have to pay Rome tax per person 3.00 euro per night - I think that's standard in rome. It is near a lot of food joints so perfect if you wanted it for wine & dining. The porter is so polite. Ummm can't think of anything bad we slept well room was lovely and clean really warm. And had a nice scent to the room almost like air fresher but there wasn't any... Channels aren't great but rooms have free wifi. Which is not very often in hotels. Can't think of anything else to add. Sorry about not just letting you know bout hotel just want you to make the most of your stay. If pleasure. If you want to know any thing else feel free to message me.

Reviews.Title: “Week Long Trip”
Reviews.Author: MichealMul
Reviews.Content: Location and service were excellent. Very handy for the metro into the city centre. Very reasonable price. It was rated as a 4 star hotel but it was a bit basic. However all of the staff were very friendly and had good English. It's "no frills" but served our purposes very well. The room was a decent size and was very comfortable. Found it a great base for visiting all of Rome's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: iandrei
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was a bit worried after reading a couple of reviews on TripAdvisor. I was expecting a tiny room, a totally unpleasant neighborhood, unfriendly staff, average breakfast and an inconvenient location. However, as soon as I checked-in and entered my room, I had a sigh of relief as nothing was true. The staff at the reception was more than friendly with us; they even checked us in 2 hours in advance! The room was cozy, clean and with all the facilities (even some sport equipments in the wardrobe) and the bathroom more than what I was expecting from a hotel in Rome. The room also had a small balcony with street view. Furthermore, the location is not unsafe, nor noisy. In fact the area at Piazza Bologna is cramped with students (it is more like a university area, or something). The breakfast was served on the roof garden; although it had heating it was a little bit cold up there, but it was January after all! They had a wide variety of cereals, fruits, yoghurts. Pastry items such as doughnuts and croissants were also available and so were cheese and ham, together with gem, chocolate, honey, etc. They had all you needed for a good breakfast. Finally, the location was not bad at all, a 7 minute stroll from the metro line. As it turned out the metro was the most convenient way of traveling through Rome and it comes really frequently. From the hotel you will need 15 minutes to reach the Collosseum and about 20-25 to the Vatican City. My overall experience at Hotel delle Province was great; I would definitely recommend it to anyone! Have a nice stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: niceguy1966
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times on business over a 3 year period. I've never had any major problems, and the service is friendly. Rooms are fairly large for Rome. Satellite TV in every room (only a couple of news stations in English, but better than nothing). The bathrooms could do with a deep clean. Nothing serious, but starting to show their age. Free WiFi, a good selection at breakfast (on the roof top!) , comfortable beds. The location is about a 10-15 minute walk from the nearest metro station, and there are many bars and restaurants in the area. Tip: Ask for a coffee from the waitress at breakfast, rather than use the coffee machine. Her coffee is 100 times better!

Reviews.Title: “OK/Good”
Reviews.Author: Dutchies007
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a bit out of town, metrostation 5-10 minutes walk. Buses very near, but difficult to understand the system. Nearby some quite good restaurants. Not a lot of facilities in the hotel, except a readering room/lobby and free Wifi which is working perfectly. Breakfast good, with both sweet and savoury things, I loved the tasty mortadella (a kind of meat) and very friendly employees. Beds nice, temperature in room perfect, everything clean. Good minibar and a safe, which is very good. We found our stay not special but were perfectly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “visit for one night”
Reviews.Author: ts m
Reviews.Content: The Staff is kind and helpful. The room was just next to the reception and the staff room and it was too noisy. There was an imergancy exit door instead of a window. The cotrol botum of the airconditionor was fixed and it was not possible to change the temperature in the room. The location of the hotel is very good, close to the underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a Rome break.”
Reviews.Author: Philippa M
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and nicely decorated. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was very good, abit cold up on the roof terrace first thing on a January morning, but they had a vast variety of goodies to choose from , so soon warmed up! Good location to get away from the tourists, felt very safe and like I could live there for longer than just 4 days.. Lovely, friendly, good value for a very good meal; restaurant just opposite. Metro station just a short 10 minute walk away. Nice local shops. Would go back again and recommend thoroughly. Well done Hotel delle Province.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: jslate1987
Reviews.Content: Was very close to the metro, within five minutes. Extremely clean a lot of marble, they helped us save half on rail tickets to Florence. They really do so much for their customers. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “visit in january”
Reviews.Author: Otto_Pe
Reviews.Content: The personnel was very kind and helpful. Our room was quite cold and the floors were freezing, carpets would help a lot. Great restaurants near the hotel and breakfast was very good and always served with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “2,5 stars more than 4”
Reviews.Author: pinky378
Reviews.Content: Definetlly not a 4 stars hotel. I saw 3 stars hotels much better than this one. Still it was a good value for money, we spent 62 € for 1 night including breakfast. The location it's good (5 min to metro station; several buses passing close the hotel), the service was nice, the room was warm (a little noisy though). The customer service at the front desk should improve. The rooms need some renovation. If you need just a place to sleep for the night i recomand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dario F
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. Our room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. The hotel's staff was very helpful. The breakfast was very good and abundant. Good position. I recommend Hotel Delle Province.

Reviews.Title: “roma”
Reviews.Author: pat w
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but our rooms were not ready on time, and we were responsible for a group of 10booking this hotel. The whole group was in their rooms while we had to wait an hour. The hotel was clean and the breakfast nice. The customer service at the front desk could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent! Thank you for the all service. We hope that we will see in the future. Big kiss!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ana a
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent! Thank you for the all service. We hope that we will see in the future. Big kiss!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PascalS87
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located on a good position in Rome and the staff was excellent. Breakfast shows not much change during the week but it is more then sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Far from Ancient Sites”
Reviews.Author: LBKTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a nice area, but we had to take the train in order to get to the downtown area where all the sightseeing is. Very nice room with A/C. Great Hotel roof top complimentary breakfast. Hotel staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel i Rome”
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: Good and clean hotel, near bologna metro station. Good breakfast and nice staff. Only problen is the thin walls. You can hear everything ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Susan158
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delle Province is easily accessible by a 20 minute bus into Rome. The staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and good-sized and breakfast is abundant and offers a varied selection. There is wi-fi and a computer available (free) for your use near the lobby. The hotel is located in a safe and quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel delle Province”
Reviews.Author: Quincebush
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and functional hotel that is a few minutes walk from Bologna metro station so its handy for travelling around. The room we checked into was snadwiched between two other rooms' bathrooms so was very noisy. We asked to move after the first night and they were helpful about this. We thought the breakfast was fine - a tip, the coffee from the machine IS awful, but you can ask the waitress for a capuccino and she will provide you one from her little room! We found the reception staff a little reticent in being helpful, but if you persisted they did know the information and would tell you. More like a three star than a four, but very ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a City Trip”
Reviews.Author: nicilicious101
Reviews.Content: The Hotel delle Province is near to Metro Station Bologna, so it´s only a 10 min. walk to the next station. It´s a nice Hotel for a City Trip and the rooms were really ok but the breakfast offer (at the 6th floor) was a little bit to less. The rooms were nice and really clean. Also the stuff was really friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: dan s
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice and modern and the breakfast was quite nice and the staff was most helpfull. Ten minute walk to metro which is necessary to reach any of the prime tourist locations.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy”
Reviews.Author: Alyna_Kytty
Reviews.Content: The price is OK. The staff in the front desk should pay more attention to the guests, but overall is OK (they stay too much on the phone...). There was a 3 euro/day city tax that our travel agency did not told us about it and we had to pay it at front desk. Not too far to Bologna Metro station - 5 min walk. The room and the bathroom was clean. The cleaning lady arranged the bed, changed the towels and refilled bath liquids every day. They have satellite TV but with a very complicated remote. The minibar prices were good. The safe in the wardrobe was easy to use and very helpful. I liked that we had telephone in the room and in the bathroom and an emergency cord in the bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price”
Reviews.Author: ccozza
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was a bit inconvenient, 5 min walk to subway or bus, (10 mins to Piazza Spagna) but otherwise great local neighbourhood. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Room was great, well appointed, My room 503 even had a patio off the side. The breakfast was simple but good, no cooked items but plenty of breads, cereals etc.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: StarGazer84
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in May of 2010 for a few nights. Location: Not the finest it must be said. It's a bit run-down. The metro is a couple of minutes up the road, whilst a walk into the city centre would take approx 20-30 mins. Service: From what I can recall the people on the front desk were helpful and polite. Room: We got stuck with a ground floor room that's only window was to the corridor! Not good. We felt very claustrophobic in there and didn't spend anymore time than we needed to in the room. The bed was fine and the bathroom was clean. All in all I wouldn't return as you'll get better value for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Terri R
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I arrived at Hotel delle Province after a long and tiring trip. We were exhausted and were looking forward to arriving at our hotel. We booked the trip through Delta vacations and expected the hotel to be decent. The reviews we read on trip advisor indicated it would be clean. It was horrible - the location was in a bad area and the hotel did not appear to be clean. I did look at the room that they had for us. I had asked for a room that would sleep four people. It had a double bed and a pull out love seat in a very tiny area. Needless to say - we did not stay. And shame on Delta vacations. They should be embarrassed to allow such a place to be a part of what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Dump in bad area”
Reviews.Author: Erin042781
Reviews.Content: This was arranged for us through Delta Vacations. We pulled up after traveling 24hrs only to find this looked nothing like the pictures. I wasn't expecting or needing 5 star accommodations, but this was the pits. It looked dirty and outdated and there was a stoned bum on the sidewalk just outside the front door. I would not have felt safe walking around the area at night. For a similar price we found a MUCH better hotel. While I was trying to get a signal on my phone so I could call another hotel, the manager started saying, "No photos". I figure it is because if I posted photos people would see the hotel is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: safakss
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room from this hotel via www.birdolutatil.com. It was a good hotel, but serves a terrible breakfast like most hotels in Italy. Reception not so helpful. Close to the metro station, and several bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lawfar60
Reviews.Content: good and qiuet area rooms very clean nd breakfast good

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Peter D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was 10 walking minutes away from the metro station. The reception was english speaking and a bell boy guided us to our room. The hotel has an elevator. The room was clean and tidy. There were a double bed, a desk, a wardrobe, a cupboard, a television set, a minibar and an air conditionong system. The bathroom had one giant mirrow, a big sink, a hair dryer, a power socket for a shaver, a toilet, a bidet and a very comfortable shower. Both rooms had great windows and were accurately cleaned every day. Although pointing on a major street, it was silent except loud speaking neighbours due to thin walls I guess. The breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace. It consisted of different fruits, toast, bread rools (a bit dry), cheese, salami, croissants, coffee, cocoa and so on. In general, the breakfast was rather sweet. In the neighbourhood of the hotel were a couple of restaurants and small stores of all kinds. The hotel provides a shuttle service to the airport, which is worthy for families or bigger groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: sr83
Reviews.Content: I visted this hotel with a friend. I became extremely unwell during the trip due to a prexisting condition, and the staff looked after me by constantly checking I was ok. Once I recovered I was able to truly enjoy Rome. As I mentioned, the staff were lovely. The room was comfy and clean and very elegant. The breakfast room was chilled and had great views. Good location, but a bit of a walk to get to the station. However, a safe and relaxed walk. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Everything ok”
Reviews.Author: drjansen
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean Break-fast Breakfast excellent Do nog forget to ask your Identity card back from desk ( I returned whithout !) H.Jansen

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to come back soon,”
Reviews.Author: Oz1963
Reviews.Content: On our arrival, the first thing I noticed was that the staff were very friendly and helpful, and they remained helpful and friendly throughout my stay. Hopefully if I visit Rome again I will use this same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was an excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: allsos
Reviews.Content: It was very good. Only the breakfest could be a little little better :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: alibaba14_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable with very helpful staff. Location in a nice residential area close to a metro station so close to Rome's tourist attractions but away from the hustle and bustle. Nice cafe close by. Breakfast basic but adequate to set you up for the day. (Don't bother with a packed breakfast if going on an early trip - find a cafe.) Breakfast room on top floor which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: logie18
Reviews.Content: Hotel had really friendly staff. Room was on the small side but was clean and comfortable. The Hotel was about a 10 minute walk from the metro station from where it was easy to reach all points of interest which was handy. Rome was fascinating. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dusty64
Reviews.Content: The hotel was old and dirty. The area around it was also dirty. If I went back to rome again I would stay closer to the middle of the town. There is not much to do around this hotel so you have to take the metro everywhere and it is dirty and hot and crowded. Even though the prices are a little higher near rome it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “basic but nice”
Reviews.Author: friarweisse
Reviews.Content: idea location close to the tube station.nice restaurant accross the road .the reception staff are very helpful and will even print out directions for specific places you with to visit which are not on the main tourist maps

Reviews.Title: “Roma, Roma, Roma! Beautiful Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: miloveyou25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Delle Province for three nights, May 9 - 12. Let me first say, the room was air conditioned, spacious and clean. The hotel is not in the centre of Rome (Termini) but about 3 stops away. The metro (subway) is a couple blocks away which is about a 5 min walk. The metro (subway) in Rome is very easy to navigate. Some revieweras complained about the location but I think their gripe is unfounded. We left in mornings to the attactions returned in the late afternoon, freshened up and return to the city centre for dinner. So the distance from the city centre isn't really and issue. It may be 10 minutes back to Termini once you leave the from door of the hotel. Again, location isn't an issue. The rooms were always cleaned when we returned. The minibar was of course stocked with overpriced warm beverages. It kept everthing slightly below room temperature. They decided to make the minibar look pretty but render it useless. My other problem was with the bathroom. It was very spacious (almost the size of a Paris hotel room) but the shower was the size of a postage stamp. A complete waste of space. But they do provide oversized bath towels that was welcomed. The front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. Five stars! I gave them a list of restaurants that I wanted to vist (from foodie blogs) and asked them to make reservations for me during my stay and they pleasantly made the arrangements. I also asked for directions to some of my restaurants and they printed out the google map and the directions. Breakfast was included and had a small variety of things to eat. It seemed to be your typical European continental breakfast. Bread, pastries, cereal, yogurt, coffee, juice... Don't Europeans eat hot breakfasts? But it was free, so I don't think I can complain. They offered soy milk upon request which was great, I have a milk allergy and I enjoyed the having the option of being able to have cereal for breakfast. All in all, the hotel was worth what we paid. Would, I stay there again? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Short but pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: elaineYul
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel for one night and this fit my needs perfectly. Hotel was situated perfectly for us. Subway is 2 blocks away and just 5 stops to the Colisseum which was the #1 site we wanted to see. Hotel staff were very nice, room was comfortable, shower was great, and the breakfast was good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well located.”
Reviews.Author: radekkr
Reviews.Content: I've spent 3 days in there last weekend, and overall the hotel met my expectations. The service was OK, the room was clean, breakfasts OK as well. I appreciated the free WiFi which I used a lot. It worked smoothly and was one of the factors why I chose the hotel, as needed to stay in touch with our family and Skype was the means to use. The hotel is located close to 2 metro stations (Tiburina and Bologna) - about 10 minutes walk. From those one can get to central Rome - Colloseum, San Pietro, Di Trevi etc. within 20 minutes easily.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming place”
Reviews.Author: anaorso
Reviews.Content: the location is fantastic, there's the subway, 4 stops from the Colosseo, there are bus stops, number 492 takes you everywhere and 649 takes u to termini. A calm district with good restaurants, bakeries and supermarket. the staff was really kind and helpful... breakfast is delicious. There's a service to the airport 24 hours. Of course, it's not a chain hotel like those around the world. It's a typical italian place, simple but cozy. I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “How is this a 4 star hotel?!?”
Reviews.Author: NCR1030
Reviews.Content: First off, it's in a terrible location...off near the university and no where near any of the sights you're going to want to see while in Rome. Second, other than the manager who we only saw when were checking out, the staff is surly, unhelpful and seem a bit untrustworthy. We checked out halfway thru our stay and moved to a 2 star hotel that was WAY better! Our rooms were in the hallway right next to the office for the front desk staff and the public restroom so it was always noisy. Our room had no window to open & get fresh air, only an emergency door that couldn't be opened or seen thru. The air conditioning didn't work very well and there was a heat wave while we were there so we couldn't even open the window to cool off or to air out the stuffy, stinky room. The carpet had some pretty nasty stains, the shower stall only consisted of two plexi glass "flaps" that came up to your waist and barely closed so the floor was covered in water after a shower & there was mold around the back of the toilet. The couple we were with had mold and mildew running down the wall under their sink and a fowl smell permeating their room. We're pretty sure most of the plumbing pipes ran behind the wall in their room lending to the smell and making a lot of noise. Most annoying though was the ice cold showers we were forced to take every morning...couldn't even get the water luke warm most of the time and if you could it only lasted for 4 or 5 minutes! Also beware, they say they offer free wifi but its only a 5 minute trial and then you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Turistic visit to Roma.”
Reviews.Author: rgarriga
Reviews.Content: The Hotel manly was correct in: The attention, personal hotel service and the cleaning frequence room. The Hotel was poor in: Facilities. The mini Bar and air conditioned doesn't work. The breakfast menu, very poor assortment, but the food and drinks was good. We missed a warm and hot food, like saussages, eggs, bacon or somethink like this that you can find in other europeans hotels. The quality-prize relation is right as a 3 stars hotel, but the hotel is a few far from the center of the Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, room and breakfast very ok, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lupocamino
Reviews.Content: Located in a not so crowded area, Metro and bus downtown easy to access (only 300 meters to Metro, only 3 stops to central bus- and railway-station). The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room and the bathroom are spacious and clean. The breakfast has a large variety of offers. If possible we will will book this hotel again for our nxt stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TACOB0B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 2 1/2 blocks downhill from the Bologna metro stop. Our room was large with plenty of closet space and hangers for our nine day stay in Rome. The room had free wifi with no problems connecting in the room and the service was reasonably fast. The bathroom included toiletries with hairdryer and plenty of hot water. The room had a small fridge/mini bar which was incredibly inexpensive, never in all of our travels have we seen mini bar items so cheap. For an example you could have a Heineken for 2 euros. Breakfast was a cold buffet with meats, cheese, bread, cereal, fresh fruit, juice, coffee and pastries. There were a couple of restaurants in the area which open for dinner at 7pm, however, we would recommend finding a place to eat before returning to the Bologna area for a wider selection. There was an excellent pastry shop on the way to the hotel from Bologna which is open late and has a great selection of pastries. The hotel was clean and even though the streets seemed a little dark at night we never felt unsafe. We had a room on the street side and had no issues wit loud street noise. The bed was 2 twins pushed together and for our personal preference was just too hard. What made this hotel was it's staff. They were always polite and friendly and always had a smile on their face. There was one young lady in particular who worked at the front desk who always went out of her way to help us with directions and suggestions and we really want to thank her for all of her help. Also everyone from the sweet, smiling housekeeper to the chipper dining room attendant to the porter who showed us to our room upon our arrival seemed to really take pride in their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “It stinks”
Reviews.Author: talltales
Reviews.Content: The room was very bad. It had a torn curtain. It really smelled bad. Some one had either perfumed it or poured baby powder in the room to try to hide the odor. I had a difficult time because I am allergic to perfume smells.

Reviews.Title: “short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dencoo
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff at all times Rooms we clean and plenty of space Breakfast plenty to choose from and lovely roof top area

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with excellent traffic connections”
Reviews.Author: mareensg
Reviews.Content: - big and comfortable rooms - very beautiful bath room - balkony - nice atmosphere - european breakfeast - bus stop and supermarket in front of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “This hotel gives us kind support.”
Reviews.Author: Hamild7
Reviews.Content: Reception woman who can speak Japanese little is very kind. And reception man is so kind that he change my room to one with bath tab when I negotiate. Let me express my heartfelt appreciation to you for your kind support ! Room is clean and big. Bath room is really good. And breakfast tastes good!!

Reviews.Title: “Sehr gutes Hotel - great value and really good”
Reviews.Author: Hoesta
Reviews.Content: Ein sehr gutes Stadthotel mit allem, was man benötigt: saubere, ruhige Zimmer (nur ein wenig Straßenlärm am Morgen), freundliches Personal, ordentliches Frühstück. Von der Piazza Bologna (U-Bahn) ca. 10 Minuten zu laufen, aufpassen bei den beiden kleinen Kreisverkehren: richtige Straße nehmen! A great Hotel with everything you need: nice, quiet rooms, only some street noise in mornings, friendly staff, decent breakfast. A 10-minute walk from underground Piazza Bologna, watch out for right street at the two roundabouts, not so easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: indiekid28
Reviews.Content: There is not much to complain about when it comes to this hotel - really friendly staff, nice room, clean/large bathroom, a really good breakfast served on the highest story, close enough to station Termini, 3 metro stops from the main tourist attractions... But : no coffee/tea facility, no window, no armchair... Really bad noise isolation, too - I could hear a neighbor snoring, my room was close to the reception desk so I could hear the phone ringing and people talking, and the worst part of it was the young child screaming in the staff's rooms for the most part of the day (it woke me up at 6:30 on 3 consecutive days).

Reviews.Title: “Nice staying for 5 days”
Reviews.Author: fabiodan
Reviews.Content: 300mts from the nearest metro station (Bologna). Near 3 restaurants, in front of an irish pub. Nice room service. Personnel was very nice. Only disadvantage are slightly noisy rooms but globally it was good.

Reviews.Title: “3 Stops from the Termini, Clean, Pleasant, Cheap Mini Bar!”
Reviews.Author: MMort_11
Reviews.Content: This is a value for money hotel, the staff were very helpful and friendly, the room is lovely, slept really well, good shower and there are nice toiletries. On the first night, we were put in a room with no opening window (there was a glass door which opened, but it was the fire escape) I complained and even though they couldn't accomodate us that night they moved us the next day, we packed our case in the morning and and got back after a day of sightseeing to be given our new room which our cases had been moved into, brilliant! The hotel is 3 stops on the subway from the Termini (this is the central transport station) there is a nice restaurant accross the road frequented by locals, 7 euros for a litre of wine and pasta/pizza from 7 euro (please note they bring you a glass of cava and bread which costs 2.50 euro's). Breakfast was continental, plenty of choice, fruit, cereal, yogurt, croissants, fantastic coffee, have to mention the mini bar, we had 4 bottles of beer and 3 bottles of water and out bill only came to just over 9 euros! What more do you want!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure to stay”
Reviews.Author: funky_o_f
Reviews.Content: Great service thanx to the kind and dedicated people in hotel Delle Province. We had a small leakage in the bathroom witheet the sink. Not to big of a problem, but nonetheless there was the technical man within à couple of minutes! Typical Italian style sweet breakfast was OK, automatic coffee machine was not very satisfying compared to what the baristas in Rome serve you. Not good, not too bad either. Location of the hotel is great, close to metro station Bologna, and in the middle of 'normal people Rome'. Some nice shoe shops closeby, and a couple of fine affordable restaurants with honest tasting food!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Vlada294472
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, metro station Bologna. The environment is urban. Transport service from the airport (Mercedes) admission to the hotel is excellent and the price is 15eur per person each way. Also, rooms are comfortable, warm and very clean. All staff are very friendly and smiling. Particularly Francesco (receptionist) is very efficient and helpful. Breakfast buffet was very good and staff was helpful and friendly. Everything was ok.

Reviews.Title: “For my next visit to Rome, Hotel Delle Province will be the first preference.”
Reviews.Author: VismoyGangoli
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel cozy and enough for me and my wife. I would prefer to stay here on my next visit along-with my son. Yes, a Restaurant added to the Hotel would add to the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely be back with family and/or friends”
Reviews.Author: jigece
Reviews.Content: I have few minor remarks to make: one lamp was not functioning over the desk; and the phone cord was not stable causing bad reception - so I had to pick up calls in the bathroom. Otherwise, all personnel were helpful and courteous. Also, I thought that wifi facilities could be offered !

Reviews.Title: “cultural treap to Italie”
Reviews.Author: frenchvisitor81
Reviews.Content: hotel confortable and clean, staff very good, just difficult to park a car

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chic-UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in November. Upon arriving at the airport, the taxi drivers scared me by saying the hotel location was too far and that it was not the best hotel in the area. I haggled my fare down to 30 Euros on a mini bus with a few other travellers. It was a pleasant surprise when we got to the hotel - it was not central but was not far at all from the centre. It was quite easy to get to on the underground which is 3 stops from Termini (the St Pancras of London). From Termini, most of the attractions are close by. The service and the facilities of the hotel were comfortable - very friendly hotel staff who could not do enough to help. As a solo young female traveller, I've had my fair share of snotty behaviour from hotel staff. This hotel was not like that all - this obviously helped my overall experience in Rome. I will definitely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: taludeid
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good decision. Had hotel van pick us up at airport (50Euro). Great location, lots off places to eat around the hotel, with a litte supermarket on the corner. Ten minute walk to metro, couple of stops to colosseum. Same location of metro got the bus stright to the Vatican. I will stay there again if i come back to rome and would recomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel well placed for the Metro”
Reviews.Author: SueCoe
Reviews.Content: All the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and we found it very useful having a safe in the room for our valuables. The mini bar was also a bonus, but it would have been good to have had tea and coffee making facilities as well. The hotel was in a good location about 10 minutes walk from Bologna Metro Station and we felt safe walking through the area even after dark. There were several reasonably priced restaurants in the vicinity including Braci e Abbraccci almost opposite the hotel and I Preistorici just off Piazza Bologna.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western sent us here after they lost our reservations - our gain.”
Reviews.Author: sstutler760
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a wonderful staff. Rooms were impeccable, and the staff helped with any of our tourist questions. The only complaint was their wireless internet which was not strong enough to reach us on the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Spoilt Our 25th Wedding Anniversary !!”
Reviews.Author: michael_c7
Reviews.Content: 0ctober 26th was our 25th wedding anniversary . So to make it special we went to Rome. I did all the usual pre trip research - looked for a 4 star hotel near the city centre and one that could add Italian flavour to our stay. I wanted it to be special. All my research pointed me to Hotel Delle Province - and I have to say TripAdvisor is partly responsible for my disatrous choice...read on So here is the resume of the "Promise and The Reality" PHOTOS ; The Promise ; A plush hotel with a welcoming exterior, spacious bedrooms and a beautiful garden breakfast room. The Reality ; The photos were taken when the place had just been built or refurbished and we took the very best angled shots we could to make it look nice. I have some to submit soon of the reality look ! RECEPTION The Promise ; A warm Italian welcome for your important stay with us The Reality ; "Do I really have to check you in" .......give me your passports and come back for them later. Your room is 109. When you complain about your room - do it when Im not on and my colleague will go through the routine of ignoring you with a smile. THE ROOM The Promise ; A lovely spacious room with nice furnishings The Reality ; A pokey little room with furniture that did not even match and was looking very tired. Net curtains that hadnt been washed for years masked our view of errmm...scruffy flats with so many aerials on top I couldnt count. The Saving Grace ...hooray - that is if you want to stay in the bathroom for your entire trip. The bathroom was lovely and the shower likewise. Here, I must also say that the room maid did a sterling job keeping it clean and excellently serviced. Pity she is not made the manager ! THE GARDEN ROOF TERRACE The Promise .......its so quaint - look at the lovely pictures !! The Reality - a huge metal door that would be better served on a walk in safe is the gateway to ......a slum ! Drab horrid tablecloths, a mouldy grotty canopy overhead and - well - errm no garden at all really - just rough concrete shelving . Great view of the graffiti smattered walls of the local area tho !! THE BREAKFAST The Promise - A lovely buffet breakfast with excellent service The Reality - A buffet with plentiful supply presented like a market stall - oh and a vending machine for your drinks. 4 star hotel with vending machine for breakfast drinks - pure class. Would have been even marginally ok if the water for the tea was hot - but IT WASNT !! After trying twice - we went for breakfast at a nice nearby cafe instead. HOTEL IN GENERAL The Promise - An Elegant and comfortable hotel centrally located. The Reality - A scruffy hotel with carpets that would best suit the area around the bar where the drinks are spilt. Oh that is - not our bar because we dont have one !! Centrally located if you mean as far east of the city as is possible !! RESUME ......If you haver booked in here - change it whilst you can. If you havent - Dont !! If you do - dont say I didnt try and help you not to If you get there despite all of this - ask NOT to have room 109 Only the valiant efforts of the room maid made me click anything higher than a 1 !!

Reviews.Title: “BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK”
Reviews.Author: DeDe_DM
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasnt located in the city center, but it was a short walk to the metro. The local restaurants were delicious and not as expensive as the one in city center.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and classy hotel situated in an attractive part of the city.”
Reviews.Author: SpyroMelb
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel wasnt located in the city centre, it was only three stops away via the nearby metro. And it was when I first went to use it, I came across the local hub of Bologna with its restaurants, cafes, pizzerias and Romanese. Hence I experienced the two sides of this amazing city, both tourist and local.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location, Perfect for budget holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: Rockbrook101
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in the first week of September for five nights and paid €415. This was great value as the hotel is a 7 minute walk from the Bologna Metro Stop, which is only a few minutes away on the metro from all the famous sights. Rooms were very clean and serviced every day with fresh towels etc. The staff are extremely friendly and most speak English. The breakfast is continental, I didn't mind it, my girlfriend not so much. It consists of cereal, bread rolls, a variety of cured meats and cheese slices. Their croissants are very sweet with something usually in the middle, tea and coffee etc. There is no restaurant or bar in the hotel but we didn't mind. If you are looking for the best accommodation on a budget that is relatively close to the main attractions then this hotel is perfect for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Derek_Eynon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was as stated but was further out than we had expected. On the information if states they offer a shuttle from airport to hotel -- this is actually a chargable taxi at 55 euros. We feel would be fair to state its a chargable service on all the leaflets so people can make a choice re this. Staff very helpful hotel a little tired in places but clean and good value for money. Air conditioning was poor really for the temperatures especially in August. Nice couple restaurants and coffess - ice shops near hotel very nice staff so not a bad location. if want more to do might be more in line with hotel a little nearer all bars and night life -- this hotel perfect for people with kids as quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel"”
Reviews.Author: wildrose1205
Reviews.Content: We found them to be very Nice. Room was nice size, breakfast was delightful, and a god sent that we didn't have to go find a place for breakfast. On the down side, Very tiny shower, but adequate. The night concierge was a little bit uncaring and rude, but everyone else was very nice. distance to the metro was about 2 long blocks. Over all great for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: anthonypaul80
Reviews.Content: This as an great location as buses and metro are close by. The hotel is very clean and service is excellent. Breakfast is very good and very friendly staff. Reception staff were all very helpful.Overall a very enjoyable stay and is highly recommended for all tourists. Book early to avoid disappointment as this hotel is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star, Smour Star”
Reviews.Author: 8eaus
Reviews.Content: The first room we were allocated had mould up the wall in the bathroom, I don't find this very acceptable for a four star hotel. After a room change I found what appeared to be rodant faeces on the balcony. The carpets had a lot of suspect stains and the over all appearance of the hotel was very poor. The breakfast was ok and the staff were helpful. The location was pretty good, it is about a 10 minute walk to the metro. I would not stay in this hotel again and I would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klang100
Reviews.Content: As we had booked this with my parents I was worried after reading some of the other reports. However this hotel offers all that you expect from a hotel here. Our room was clean and tidy and it was also cleaned everyday. Although the hotel is not in the centre of the city both a bus and metro are only two minutes away. We walked to the bologna and got the on the metro or got the no. 62 bus into town getting of at the Trevi Fountain. The only down side to this hotel is that it doesn’t have a bar. However there is a mini bar in the room with cheap drink but beware record what you take as both rooms in our party had things on their bill that they did not take. Anyway there is a bar across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but too far out”
Reviews.Author: SButler
Reviews.Content: Hotel delle Province is located in the university area of Rome. It is a good 20 minute walk to Termini station. If you are happy enough getting around by train/metro then this is now a problem. However, we walked and we found it a bit too far out. The hotel is graded as 4* - it is a bit dated and would need decorated. The carpet in our room was well worn and coming up in places. Staff were friendly and helpful. They provide slippers and toiletries! Breakfast is served in the garden room on 6th floor. As breakfasts go it was ok - enought to get you started! There was a mini bar in the room and the big plus was the prices were actually very reasonable. No main bar in the hotel! I wouldn't use this hotel again simply because of its location.!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money, Very near metro, ten mins to city on metro”
Reviews.Author: kilkennytravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in april for originally 4 nights but due to the volcano we had to stay an extra 3, this was no problem and reception rebooked us every night. The surrounding area is not as bad as other reviews make out, there are some nice restaurants down the road. We paid e100 a night for the 2 of us, very cheap so i thought the room would be awful...but it was great. lots of wardrobe space, toiletries, cheap minibar and english language Sky, which was great given we were stranded, we could catch up on the news! Also breakfast was way more varied than i thought it would be, cold meats, pastries, cereals, fruit salad, juice etc. V Friendly breakfast staff too, would DEFINITELY go back in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but needs updating. Surrounding area poor, but near the Metro.”
Reviews.Author: JohnAndDawn08
Reviews.Content: Our first room was damp and stank of air freshenner, but we were moved to another room the next day without any problems. Rooms have a good TV and SKY, cheap minibar and free safety deposit box. Breakfast is reasonable but not hot. Local area doesnt offer much, but the Bologna Metro staion is about a 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “I loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Bendida
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything I expected - perfect location and excellent service! The room was comfortable and simply beautiful with a nice balcony and a spacious bathroom. The breakfast was very good - rich and tasty and people at the reception desk were quite helpful. I was glad to find such a charming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family who are going to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: jcassidy50
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at your hotel, it was very clean, and the staff was courteous. I actually did recommend it to my Travel Agent who had clients who were asking about your hotel. I gave it very good reviews and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripAdhotels
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, big room, close to metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was great and the rooms were spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: ShuggieP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights and were very pleased with the size of the room, the cleanliness of the room, the bathroom (including the bath amenities), and the breakfast selections. Unfortunately, I could hear everything the people in the next room were saying -- and honestly, they were not being unreasonably loud. I could even hear their bathroom activities. Chalk it up to old buildings! As others have mentioned, this place is outside of the city center, so be prepared to metro, bus, or walk. The breakfast selections were fantastic -- breads, meats, cereals, fruits, pastries, yogurt... what else could you need?!?!? Small tip -- don't get the coffee from the self serve machine. Kindly ask the breakfast attendant for your beverage of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price/quality”
Reviews.Author: zwika
Reviews.Content: The check out was a bit too early. Most hotels check out are at 12.00. For the rest everything perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly people, clean and confortable room and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: javi_lopez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 5 minutes walking to a Metro station. The room was very confortable and clean. The bathroom was clean and had a modern equipment. The breakfast was not very varied but things were quality. Staff was very frienly

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: PRMCLeiden
Reviews.Content: The staff was efficient and correct The room was clean and comfortable, with free wi-fi access very useful if you travel for business and the best surprise: the prices of the mini-bar were very "affordable". Breakfast is served in the 6th floor from where you can see the typical roman trees (pine trees) in the horizon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Lanzafan75
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here in room 120. Excellent room - very clean, well made, lots of space and TV had English news channels like Sky News, Fox, plus some other English-language channels. Team there were very friendly and helpful, including Alessandro at the front desk. Location was very good. Away from centre of Rome but nearest Metro is 5 mins walk away and only 3 stops (about 10 mins max) to central Rome. Would stay there again next time and would recommend it anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: booooooooooook
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice Hotel with very friendly Servicepeople and large Rooms. We had a big and beautyful gallery at our room. You can reach the Termini in a few minutes by metro B (station Bologna).

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ErrikaGreece
Reviews.Content: Location was good. 10-15 min walk from the metro station but I think we were given one of the worst rooms they had. On the ground floor rooms are small with no window but one in the bathroom. Paint was falling of the walls in several places in the room. I would not call that a 4 star hotel - yet the price was not expensive and the location handy so we decided not to move. Do not know the stage of the rooms on the upper floors...maybe better..??. The one plus I can give to this hotel is the breakfast room and the breakfast itself.

Reviews.Title: “A good and cozy hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Coulomb
Reviews.Content: Acceptable size room and bathroom (also for two persons). Good location close to a major station (Roma Tiburtina). Acceptable continental breakfast with a moderate selection of food. Free wireless internet. Only little traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and familiar hotel”
Reviews.Author: galiciaRomana
Reviews.Content: In my opinion the hotel is very comfortable and situated in a quiet area. It is a good choice if you want to go Rome to visit the whole city and you need a quit place to relax and have a rest. Nice Service and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, but hotel needs a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Cal-gourmet
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was quiet, but carpets are quite dirty. No maid service one day. Apparently if you don't put the "clean my room" sign on the door, they don't. Simple breakfast of rolls, cereal, and some cold cuts- no eggs, bacon, or sausage, which is a little surprising for a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel We've Stayed at in 14 days of travel through Europe and Italy”
Reviews.Author: 71Firebird
Reviews.Content: These guys are very crooked... they don't have any kind of extra services that a 4 star hotel should have. Their on sight Parking is a person next door that will charge you $30 for 5 hours of parking. Their airport service will cost you about $100 where you can get a cab for about $40. They have breakfast that is as simple as toast and milk. They have no exchange service. Their employees are rude. Their rooms are dirty. Their carpet is dirty, and needs updating. Their Air Conditioning Does Not Work. I would never subject any one else to stay at this hotel... don't throw your money away... stay at a real 4 Star Hotel. Very Crooked People.

Reviews.Title: “Damp, Dark and Uninspiring.”
Reviews.Author: dmgh
Reviews.Content: The first impressions did not match the expectations of the hotels website. A tired feel to the hotel. The rooms had a dark, damp feel to them and the bathroom shower was not up to standard. The rooftop breakfast offered little choice and there was only one member of staff who was frantically trying to do the job of three. The views were just of other Rome apartments. The only positive parts of the hotel were the reasonably priced minibar, complimentary soaps and shower gels and the fact it was only 5 mins walk from the metro. This hotel overall was overpriced, tired and was only just the standard of a 3star hotel, never a 4star as advertised. I stayed in another 4star hotel in Rome during my time there and there was no comparision.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing rooms make this a barely 3 star, perhaps even 2 star affair”
Reviews.Author: Chiquitawonder
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms at this hotel after reading the positive reviews about this place. The rooms were disappointing - dark and damp with poor ventilation. Washroom was clean, but again, dark and depressing. Not recommended for people suffering from allergies as carpets looked old and several members of our party complained of itchy and running noses through the night. Breakfast buffet was adequate, but as mentioned by a previous reviewer, not refilled. The positives included friendly service particularly at the reception desk who directed us to food, metro, etc. Good luggage storage with no problems. Location was a little far from the subway, but if you are not in a rush, this should not be a problem. The hotel is located in a quiet less touristy area. It was interesting to see the non-touristy part of Rome in action. Internet was free but variable with poor reception in the rooms. We would probably not stay here again as there is nothing special about this hotel, and in fact the rooms left much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “3 star not 4 star as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Meloie
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises itself as a 4 star but the rooms and the service in the breakfast area is definitely 3 star at best. We booked a deal through expedia and stayed in Rome for 3 nights. It probably worked out at 200euros/night. Negatives: 1) Location: even though 500m from Bologna metro, Rome's metro is not great. Only 2 lines for central Rome. Walking to the main eating areas takes 20-30mins which is not a bad thing in itself as Rome really is a great city to walk through, however this meant that it took 1 hr to get to any decent lively area for a meal in a Piazza (Navone for example) from the hotel. The Metro also closes at 11.30pm on weekdays and 12.30 am weekends- not convenient if relying on the metro rather than taxis. Staying close to the sights/piazzas/bars would avoid this although probably more expensive. Our next time in Rome will definitely be in touristy-Rome to avoid this problem 2) Service/Breakfast: served on the 6th floor with decent district views. Be warned, standard breakfast only with minimal choice beyond cereal. The bread baskets were not topped up past 10am and everything was whisked away and shut down at 10.29 and 59 seconds. No leeway there. Almost felt like bootcamp. 3) Rooms: tv only had free Italian channels. No CNN or BBC available. Pay-per-view Sky available. We stayed on the ground floor near the back terrace and we had to have the curtains drawn all the time due to passing foot traffic as the windows faced the main corridor. Room was old and tired. Ventilation didn't work in the bathroom. 4) Why 3 star? No room service, restaurant. Ironing not allowed in rooms. They wanted to charge 5euro per garment initially but then reduced it to 4euro per garment. Still a ripoff seeing as they disallowed ironing. Also see points 2 and 3. Advantages: 1) Reception service was warm and friendly. 2) Taxi service to airport at 45 euros definitely worth it. Not only do you avoid the crazy Rome crowds but the route includes driving past the Colosseum and a Pyramid built by an egocentric bureaucrat. Advice for Rome in general: 1) at the airport (FCO) do not listen to the locals. Take the express into Termini (and not the all stops, jam-packed, hot, long and painful line to Tiburtina). Spend the 11euro/person cf. 5.50 euro/person 2)Sistine Chapel is closed on Sundays except for the last Sunday of the month 3) Frommer's guidebook is not detailed enough 4)buy the Romapass for 23euros which allows free use of the public transport system (not the trains from the airport however) and free entry into 2 exhibits. More importantly it allows you to walk past the mega-long queues at the Colosseum waiting to buy a ticket. Romapass valid for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Good service overall....but do speak out if you have problems”
Reviews.Author: Mlee21
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was easier than I thought it'd be. You get off at the Bologna station on Linea B on the metro and its around a 500m walk down the hill. I stayed here for 3 nights in the so-called lift room. This was basically a room on the ground floor which was next to the lift mechanics so whenever someone used it, you could hear them go up and down. It does get annoying after a while and if you do want to change room if you are unlucky enough to be given this room, request it first thing in the morning so it can be arranged for you. However, after walking 7 hours around Rome, the noise of the lift wasn't loud enough to keep me awake at night and it was however loud enough to wake me up in the morning in time for breakfast and my long day ahead for sight-seeing. The internet can be used on your laptop for 5 euros for 2 hours which is a bargain in your own room. Rome wise, I used a Roma Pass that cost me 23 euros and it gave me 3 days transport and gave me free entry to 2 monuments. This gave me no queue problems at colloseum as the pass allowed me to skip the long ticket queues and head straight into the amazing theatre. If you need any more information on the hotel or what to do in Rome then send me a message and I will be more than happy to assist you. I stayed there for 3 nights and made the most of it - food can also be pricey so if this is a problem within your budget then I can tell you where was decent also for a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel; well located”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyl1973
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a 5 minute walk from Bologna metro station, which is 5 minutes on the metro from the Colloseo station. Convenient for getting around and a massive saving on those hotels situated in the "centre". Staff were all very friendly and obliging. Lift was broken the first day we stayed, 6 floors (12 flights) up to breakfast and that before a day walking Rome’s streets!! The room had no window, but was well insulated from outside noise, but not from Mr & Mrs Loud in the room next door, there are a few rooms without windows. Otherwise it was clean and comfortable; the safe and a/c were useful. Breakfast was the normal continental affair and was generally good quality. Ask for proper Italian coffee from the staff rather than use the coffee machine at the buffet which produced revolting instant based stuff. Stendahl Bar on P.zle delle Province does decent lunch & has food/drink to takeaway. There are great restaurants around Cavour metro frequented by Romans. Avoid Coliseum on Saturday; it’s heaving. One ticket does Coliseum/Forum/Palatine & is valid for 2 days. OAPs generally get in free (except the Vatican!). St Peters is quieter after lunch. Capitoline museum entry only valid for 4 hours after 1st entry, making a day there tricky. Metro ran a reduced service 14:00-17:00 with packed trains every 8 mins!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatbadger
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I have just recently come back from this Hotel (booked via Venere) and pleased to report that we were very happy with all apsects of this hotel and service. As we landed at 10am at Ciampino airport and figured that we couldn't check into the hotel until 2pm, we decided to have a bash at taking public transport with our suitcases and hand luggage. We bought our tickets for 7 Euros in total for all three of us which was cheap considering it would have cost us 45 Euros by taxi. Anyway, it was an experience! Lol! We struggled to get on the busses because it was a free for all and we were just didn't feel right pushing our way on. It took us three attempts before elbows came into play and we successfully managed to get onto the third bus that came along (and there was a wait of 40mins between each bus). We managed to find our way to the hotel four hours later, through the pouring rain and after doing plenty of running around. It was a good way of engaging with the locals and I'm glad that we did this. Most people we asked for help from didn't speak any English but they tried to assist nevertheless. I was pleased with the locals. The authorities are a different breed, they spoke English but couldn't be bothered to help. The Hotel staff speak very good English so we didn't have any language issues and found them to be very friendly. I thought staff member Omar was the most helpful and friendliest. Our room and bathroom were clean and well made up. Air con didn't work so well but I didn't make an issue about it. This was a surprise trip for my wife's 40th Birthday and I was pleased that the staff had remembered this from a note I had sent them in advance and they brought up a complimentary bowl of fruit with a note wishing her a happy birthday. This was a nice touch and I had completely forgotten that I had mentioned this in my booking. I just wanted them to wish her a happy birthday so the bowl of fruit was a nice touch. The hotel is in a bit of a grotty location and as somebody else has mentioned it can look a bit miserable after dark when all shutters are down. We didn't feel intimidated or threatened in any way, so don't be put off. Nice Chinese restaurant around the corner with good reasonably priced menu and very friendly service. An Irish bar across the road but I only popped in there for a quick drink. Seemed okay. The Hotel is 500m from nearest metro station (Bologna) which is a bit of a walk up a hill. I'm very unfit but it did me some good. Free safe in room is a plus. We got quite excited about the sky tv only to find out that there was only one English channel. We missed out on the X-factor final this year as a result (We are sad...I know!). The mini bar was reasonably priced and not a complete rip-off. Overall, we were happy with our stay and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Garry05
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel . I booked a twin bedded room which was modern , large by Rome standards and very clean. The bathroom although it did not have a bath it had a fantastic power shower. The bathroom was excellent and was spotless with a great supply of towels etc. The room had Sky t.v. and a mini bar.Breakfast is the usual buffet style with plenty of choice and good quality. Breakfast is served on the 6th floor with nice views. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. The only thing that i could fault the hotel on was it states it is in the university part of town so i was expecting trendy / cheap cafes - shops etc but there was none. The location is good about 5 mins walk from the subway (not 400 meters) and it is only 3 stops into the centre. The location felt safe. I would defintly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canuckwilltravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were passing through Rome for only 1 night, so we decided to stay at this Hotel. With 4 suitcases, the journey to the Hotel from the Subway was the not the most pleasant. It is quite a way from the station but once you arrive at the Hotel, all of our frustration seemed to disappear. The check-in went smooth, we were helped to our room, and the whole Hotel was rather nice. The rooms were quiet, the Bathroom was very clean, but the beds weren't the best. I am over 6' tall, so my legs hung over the end. I'm used to this, as most Italians aren't as tall us. The breakfast in the morning was excellent, fresh fruit, cereal, cold meats and cheese, and fresh pastries. We decided after the long walk from the subway with 4 bags that we would take a cab to the train station as we were off to Venice. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone who wants a good nights sleep who doesn't mind being away from the Downtown of this quite large city.

Reviews.Title: “Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cannock_ukBob
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 9- night stay. The room was clean and pleasant with full bathroom and bidet. It had electronic room key but was a little bijou. There was a free room-safe and relatively cheap mini-bar (e.g. wine 3eu, water 1eu) .The room and hotel were quiet even though we were next to the lift. It is only 500 metres from Bologna Metro but if you have cases, Rome’s metro stations do not have an all-escalator exit. If you pre-book in UK you can get from Ciampino airport to Termini Station for 10euro return per person by Terravision Coach! Don’t be put off by the somewhat drab walk to the hotel, worse when shops are closed and graffiti on the shutters is very visible. The rooms all have SKY TV but before you get excited only one channel, BBC WORLD is in English! The sixth floor restaurant (for breakfast only) is excellent and has good views across the suburbs. Fare includes hot and cold drinks, an abundance of fruit, yoghurt, bread, cereal, meat and cheese and the attentions of a very good waitress/manager. There is no restaurant or bar. The friendly reception staff all speak English and when the Hotel (which is only 8 years old) has a major refurbishment in November there will be more facilities including a ground floor bar. You can get to all the main tourist sites from one of the two metro lines starting at Line B at Bologna and it’s very cheap, too. There are very few restaurants in the immediate area but one stands out; The “Restaurant Chines” only 150 metres north of the hotel on Piazza del Province at which you can get a superb well –cooked and appetising ‘banquet’ including drinks all for around 12 euros each! Whist on the subject of restaurants ; a tip worth knowing is that McDonalds have restaurants right by the Spanish Steps and immediately in front of the Pantheon. A good cappuccino is 1eu and an ice cream cone a mere 50 cents. Don’t be put off by the stereotype, the Spanish Steps Restaurant is palatial and the Pantheon offers the best seats overlooking the square. If you hire a car, at present there is FREE mid-street parking provided you can tolerate the frantic Italian driving! Altogether a good holiday experience based in a small but comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: acdoc522
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing. The staff was very friendly, and offered advice about what to do and how to do it. However, the hotel is a 30 minute walk from Termini, and about an hour walk from the Spanish Steps. (This made our nights rather quiet - being outside of the city center). We were able to walk for the first two days of our stay, but for the following three days we bought the Roma pass (which included a subway/bus pass) and used that. There is a bus stop nearby and a subway station about 4 blocks away. The hotel room was very spacious for a European room, and everything in the room was immaculate. Also, the towels in the bathroom were laundered every day. Finally, the best part was the breakfast. We had booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this site, and some reviewers were not impressed with the breakfast. However, we felt that it was more than sufficient to carry us through dinner. It included juice, coffee, tea, bread, cereal, yogurt, deli meats and fresh fruits. Overall, we had an amazing stay here and would recommend it to anyone that wouldn't mind being outside of the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Underhand Hotel tactics”
Reviews.Author: lonsdalematt
Reviews.Content: This hotel put us in a small room, by which we originally specified a larger room, after the first night however they put us in the correct type of room, without any compensation of any sort. Another suprise was in store. They charged us for a Baby Cot at the rate of 15 euros per night which was not originally communicated to us. We assumed it was inclusive in the price. So we ended up paying an extra 60 euros for our stay on the basis of 4 nights. This is an underhand tactic by a typical greedy hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pokey0334
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at this Hotel while we vacation in Rome. The Hotel was rated as a 4 star and it lived up to that rating. The Hotel was very clean, Hotel staff very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was more than we expected. The Hotel is located in the University area of Rome, so transportation to the historical sites is required. A bus stop just up the street will take you to the bus terminal , or a taxi ride for about 11 euros. I would stay at this Hotel the next time we travel to Rome..so thank you Hotel Delle Province for making our stay a very pleasant one

Reviews.Title: “Suite not so sweet”
Reviews.Author: Oakleigh7
