Reviews.Content: I took a long time selecting a hotel as we were looking for somewhere near an underground station and which had a suite at a reasonable price. After much searching we decided on Hotel Delle Province as it stated it was 400 metres from the nearest station and the suite was just £340 for 4 nights. We wanted a suite so we could put our baby daughter to bed in the seperate bedroom at her usual time of 8pm and this would leave us peace in the living area to relax. Upon entering the room we discovered that the living area and sleeping area were all the same room, so were very disappointed. I went down to reception to say that it was a suite we had booked, only to be informed that it was the suite we were given. So be warned anyone that expects a suite to mean seperate bedroom and living area. The room however was of a good size and in good condition as was the bathroom. There was also an exercise bike in the corner, which we were able to make good use of as a clothes peg. Another downside was that to me this is more a large guest house than a hotel as there is no bar or restaurant in the building. However there is a breakfast area on the 6th floor with a nice view. The breakfast was a buffet of cereals, croissants, cold meats, bread and various juices. All of which were tasty and set us up for a days sightseeing. The hotel was indeed about 400 metres from the nearest underground station which meant it was relatively easy to reach various parts of Rome. As we didnt know how to get to the hotel from the main train station (Termini), we decided to get a taxi and this cost us 15 Euro. I would advise people purchase the BIG ticket for travelling around Rome, costing 4 Euros per day (also option to purchase 3 day ticket for 11 Euro) and which enables you to travel all day on the underground or the buses. There are very few restaurants near the hotel, but instead a lot of small shops selling pizza slices which seemed to be all luke warm. One last thing, when checking out we were told that the charge for the baby cot we requested was 15 Euro per night, which we thought was a complete rip off. Maybe I'm just too used to Irish hotels providing this for free. After stating my shock and that I wasnt purchasing the cot, the receptionist went off to a room and came back saying they would only charge 10 Euro per night. Still a rip off, but at least I saved 20 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Good, friendly and affordable”
Reviews.Author: fkaway
Reviews.Content: I’m always sceptical when it comes down to a 3 or 4*-hotel, especially in major cities. But without doubt I can confirm that our 4-days stay at this hotel was nice, although I’d rather rate it as a 3 stars property. It took around 30mins. by taxi from the airport Ciampino (approx. EUR 60 incl. tipping), on the way back we booked the hotel shuttle for EUR 45! With public transportation we were told that it takes approx. 40mins. incl. 2 transfers. The hotel is embedded in a quiet neighborhood and the university isn’t too far. So there are local busses No. 492 & 310 bringing you to and from the city or even faster, walk to the metro station at Piazza Bologna (less than 10mins.) and take the metro line B to most of the sites. You’ll pass various restaurants, supermarkets and café-bars where we had our local cornetto and typical café for EUR 0.80 (=size of an espresso in Switzerland). The included breakfast was plentiful but not typical local. The hotel had very friendly and helpful reception staff, our rooms on the 5th and 1st floor were both rather small (also with narrow twin beds), but clean, with inroom safe, flat screen TV with international satellite program (Fox, CNN, Sky) and a great plus was the modern bathroom equipped with hairdryer, bidet, tower heater, shower cabinet. Other than that the hotel service was nearly null but an internet PC at charge at the hotel lobby. We booked our rooms through 2 well-known German hotel booking sites and had a great deal for February in the great city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Milleens
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel in Rome is a nightmare. There are so many of them and they are so expensive. How does one choose? Well after an exhaustive search I found the Hotel delle Province. This hotel was built in 2002 so there's no need to worry about damp rooms or a dilapidated building. Other reviews complain about the star rating of this hotel. I can't say that I am very knowledgeable about the distinctions between star-ratings but I found this hotel really lovely. The pictures on the website are very true-to-life and represent the hotel well. The breakfast room was really nice and they served a large and varied breakfast until late in the morning (7:30-10:30) so it was still possible to have a sleep-in. This hotel is well-located near the Bologna metro-stop which is less than 10 minutes walk and the metro is quite cheap. Day tickets cost 4 euro and a tourist ticket for 3 days costs around 11 euro. The hotel is on a well-populated street so there are no worries walking back there at night and I didn't have any problems with noise although I was not staying on the street-side of the hotel. The advantage of staying a little bit outside the city centre is that the restaurants and cafes are not too expensive. My cousin stayed in the centre of Rome a few weeks before me and she found if very expensive to eat near her hotel in the city centre. There is a restaurant and a pub directly across the road from the Hotel delle Province so you don't need to go far if you don't want to. I stayed there in December and the rooms were quite inexpensive. It cost 238 euro for 4 nights although I realise that this price varies depending on the time of the year that you go to Rome. The staff there were very friendly and helpful. Overall, I was quite happy with the hotel and if I were travelling again to Rome, I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but maybe a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MellanzaneMadman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel delle Province for the last 2 nights of a 10 day trip to Italy. The hotel is not located in a central tourist location, which is kind of nice. It is 2 stops on the subway from the Colesium / ruins section of Rome. The disadvantage to the location is that it's pretty inconvenient to go back to your hotel in the middle of the day if you want to take a break. Other than that, it's fine. About a 10 Euro taxi ride from the main train station. The hotel is a pretty standard hotel - rooms were clean. Our room had kind of a funky smell to it, nothing horrible but kind of noticeable. After a couple minutes we were used to it. The bathrooms are nice and clean - large showers. Breakfast was nice - pretty standard Italian hotel breakfast: toast, tea, juices, fruit, etc. The subway stop is about a 10 minute walk (maybe slightly less) from the hotel. It's the easiest way to get to the places you want to go. Overall, this hotel is fine - I just thought it was a bit overpriced for what it is. Someone else wrote in a review that it should be a 3-star hotel, not 4-stars. I absolutely agree with that. Quick tip for dinner in Rome: There is a great section of Rome with bars and restaurants right off the Piazza Novona (close to the Pantheon). Great small places, local feel, good food. The Piazza itself is pretty touristy - but this section is just a block or two west of the Piazza. This is nowhere near the Hotel delle Province hotel, but worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: wordtraveller35
Reviews.Content: We were orginally surpose to stay at the Jolly Midas hotel. But it did not work out. We stayed at the Hotel Delle Province. It was a wonderful and charming hotel. It is not in the city. But it is a nice a quiet atmosphere. It is very easy to get there by train. Dont forget to get the Roma pass or the Italian weekly pass if your staying a week. Realize that to get to the hotel it is a short walk. Also you can take bus #61 or 62 into the city. It wiill drop you off at the fountains. I would say if your a family like us stay at this hotel. The breakfast was great. The staff was very helpful at helping us find directions to were we wanted to go,

Reviews.Title: “It should be a 3 star hotel, not 4”
Reviews.Author: Gremio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is also known as Millenium hotel. This hotel wouldn't be a bad 3 stars, but if it is rated 4 stars you expect more than they can provide. The location is not good, it is far from Rome's main attractions and there are none restaurants close by. The breakfast is very good and it is included in the room rate. The service isn't good; we had to request them to check our room’s shower three times before getting it fixed. The room was very spacious though.

Reviews.Title: “Staff who care!”
Reviews.Author: benadem
Reviews.Content: Before I left Hong Kong, I received an SMS from the hotel offering to arrange a limo from the airport. This they did at a reasonable price. On my arrival, the hotel staff were extremely courteous and helpful and I was soon comfortably ensconced in my room, the size of which afforded me a pleasant surprise. The next morning, I was well looked after by the hotel staff, who provided me with a packed breakfast, as I had to depart before the hotel breakfast session started. The person who had just come on duty when I came downstairs for my bus was most concerned because he thought I would miss breakfast, and was rushing off to get me a packed breakfast when I told him I had one already. After partaking of a delicious breakfast on my last morning, I duly checked out and was pleasantly surprised to receive various small gifts as souvenirs of my brief stay there. A very satisfying experience. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “First visit to the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: holidayfromhell11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2006,booked through Last Minute as a 4 star hotel. Bed and Breakfast 508GBP for 4 nights.(The room rate direct with hotel was 550E -some profit margin-so you pay for waiting till the last minute!!) MInuses- Rates far too high for quality of accommodation. Rooftop room with view only open for breakfast 7-10am!!! A very small room with no window and damp on 2 walls. No bar or restaurant, only a lobby at the front door for guests waiting for a taxi etc. No good eateries nearby-fine if you can live on carry out pizza or pasta for your stay. Reception staff dismissive. Enquiries met with disinterest. Too far from the centre running up bills for taxis-we did try the metro and buses a few times but the bus line is not very salubrious for foreigners and we were warned about pickpockets which made us a bit nervous..... Food generally poor and far too expensive. We booked a guidebook recommended restaurant near the via del corso-oh dear -50gbp for a terrible meal Trattorias where we expected home made goodies, not much better. Pluses House staff excellent-cleaner and waitress in breakfast room kindly and warm Rome is the most wonderful city in the world. Full of history, friendly taxi drivers, other tourists chatty and interested. Atmospheric and enthralling. The Vatican,Trevi fountain at night, Colloseum....fantastic. When we go back we will 1.book accommodation in the historic centre 2.and go self catering!

Reviews.Title: “never a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: michaelbaxter
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed at the hotel delle province for 3 nights and i was hugely dissappointed. Not too much wrong with it but not a 4 star. No bar, no pool, not allowed electrics in your room so no phone charging, no iron etc.... The staff were quite helpful on the whole although if you have a grievance they suddenly become quite rude. The hotel is a 20 Euro taxi fare from the sights so dont be fooled by its location. The rooms are very small and are in need of being refurbished. I went with my girlfriend who has worked in hotels for 11 years and she was as dissappointed as me. Great holiday, but very poor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Long way out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate for our needs, but does require a lot of traveling on bus or metro to get to sights, shops etc. Nothing wrong with rooms or service - in fact staff were all very helpful and polite. Room fine, beds comfortable, shower room surprisingly good, but slightly disappointing buffet breakfast. The only major complaint is the distance from main tourist areas, but you get what you pay for... The concierge helped greatly with advising us to use Bus No.63 which runs from the nearby metro close to most major sights, and on to the Vatican. Never needed another bus! Distance from metro & bus to hotel is no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stop off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Hotel just for a long weekend during October. We found it quite difficult to initially find the hotel. Our first impression was "gosh, it does look different to the pictures," but we were just looking forward to lying down after a long journey in the rain. The porter that was sent to us to show us to our room, did not even offer to carry our luggage. Topped off by the fact he could speak very few words in English which was very difficult to communicate with him. However, the room and bathroom was very clean and contained all the neccessities in it that made the stay pleasant. The breakfast provided however, was an average continental breakfast. This was not complimented with the waitresses very rude, abrupt and arogant attitude. Which had by this time swayed our oppinion of the hotel completely. The one good thing that sticks out the most about this hotel was, when we had mastered the different bus routes and how to make the varous connections. We found the hotel to be very central indeed. Which meant we did not have to spend that much time there (smile).

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel delle Province
HotelInfo.Address: Viale delle Provincie 103, 00162 Rome, Italy
